name: _til_js__btoa.md
content:
# Base64 Encoding and Decoding

btoa() function in the browser context allows you to encode ASCII string in base-64. Pretty neat to have a very accessible function that allows for creating unique values from a given string but apperantly this function is not suitable to be used on Unicode strings. You can use the atob() function to decode the base-64 encoded string.

More information is at this [mdn page](https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/API/WindowBase64/Base64_encoding_and_decoding)
